title: Define GraphQL Schema for Salesforce Data Integration
summary: This PR introduces a GraphQL schema that mirrors the existing REST API structure for Salesforce data. The schema includes types, queries, and mutations necessary for interacting with Salesforce data through GraphQL.

review_states.comment: I've reviewed the schema and noticed that some mutations don't align with our existing REST API structure. Please revise these mutations to ensure consistency. Once these changes are made, we should be in a good spot.
The types and fields are well-defined, but the descriptions could be clearer. Please enhance the documentation for each type and field to aid future developers.

title: Integrate Transformer Models for Enhanced NLP
summary: This PR integrates transformer models into the existing AI framework to improve natural language processing capabilities. The focus is on leveraging pre-trained models to enhance the accuracy of Slack workflow automation.

review_states.comment: The integration seems solid, and the transformers are set up correctly. However, the NLP accuracy improvement is around 18%, not quite hitting the 20% mark we aimed for. Please address this issue.

The integration looks promising, but there are a couple of edge cases where the new model doesn't perform as expected. Consider tweaking the model parameters or adding more training data to address these issues.

title: Integrate Feedback Bot into Slack
summary: Implement the core functionality of the feedback bot within Slack to collect real-time user feedback during the onboarding process. This includes setting up the bot's basic interaction capabilities and ensuring it can be triggered at appropriate times without disrupting user workflow.

review_states.comment: The integration looks solid! The bot triggers perfectly during the onboarding process without any hiccups. The security measures seem robust. LGTM, approved! ðŸš€
The bot's interactions are smooth and don't disrupt the user's workflow. The bot is well integrated and secure. LGTM, approved! ðŸŽ‰

title: Implement Edge Computing for Slack Workflow Processing
summary: This PR introduces edge computing capabilities to process Slack workflows closer to the data source, reducing latency and improving performance. It involves deploying lightweight processing units at strategic locations to handle initial data processing and decision-making.

review_states.comment: The edge computing nodes are successfully deployed and integrated with our existing system. The edge nodes are handling over 80% of the initial data processing tasks, which should offload our central servers. LGTM, approved! ðŸŽ‰

The integration looks seamless, and the latency reduction is over 20%, which is fantastic. The tests are comprehensive and cover all critical scenarios. Everything seems reliable and performs well under load. Same here, LGTM! Approved! ðŸš€

title: Revert PR# 4: Implementation of Edge Computing for Slack Workflow Processing
summary: This revert is necessary due to a change in product direction. The new focus is on centralized processing to streamline our infrastructure, making the edge computing capabilities introduced in PR# 4 misaligned with our current goals. Reverting this PR will help avoid unnecessary complexity and ensure alignment with our strategic objectives.

review_states.comment: LGTM
Approved

title: Design Intuitive UI Components for Feedback Bot
summary: Create user-friendly and intuitive UI components for the feedback bot to enhance user interaction. This includes designing message templates, buttons, and any other interactive elements that facilitate easy feedback submission.

review_states.comment: The message templates look great and are user-friendly. However, the buttons need to be fully responsive on mobile devices as they appear off-center.
The feedback submission process is straightforward, but consider reducing the number of clicks needed to submit feedback by combining some steps.

title: Enhance Data Caching Mechanisms for Salesforce Integration
summary: This PR focuses on optimizing the current data caching mechanisms used for Salesforce data integration. It aims to reduce data retrieval times and improve the overall efficiency of data handling within the Slack workflows.

review_states.comment: The PR looks solid! The caching mechanisms are definitely more efficient now. I see you've implemented strategies for cache invalidation and updates, which should keep our data fresh. Great job on the unit and integration tests too! LGTM, approved! ðŸŽ‰

I agree with Charlie. The data retrieval times are noticeably improved, and the cache invalidation strategies are well thought out. The tests cover all the critical areas. Everything meets the acceptance criteria. Well done! LGTM as well, approved! ðŸš€

title: Revert PR#7: Integration of Transformer Models
summary: This revert is necessary to address critical bugs and performance issues introduced by the integration of transformer models in PR#7. The integration has caused delays in processing requests and automated responses are not triggering correctly, affecting the stability of our application. Reverting this PR will restore functionality while we work on a solution.

review_states.comment: Looks good

title: Implement Resolvers for Complex GraphQL Queries
summary: This PR adds resolvers for handling complex queries within the GraphQL schema. These resolvers are designed to efficiently fetch and process data from Salesforce, ensuring optimal performance and accuracy.

review_states.comment: The resolvers look solid and cover all complex queries defined in the schema. However, please double-check a couple of test cases where the data returned wasn't as expected to ensure accuracy.
The implementation is thorough, but please include the performance benchmarks and update the test cases. Let us know when it's ready for another review.

title: Optimize Data Pipelines for Real-Time Processing
summary: This PR optimizes the data pipelines to support real-time processing of Slack and Salesforce data. The goal is to ensure that data is processed and available for AI models with minimal latency.

review_states.comment: The optimizations look solid, and the end-to-end tests verify real-time processing effectively. The documentation updates are clear and concise, making it easy to follow the new architecture changes. LGTM, approved!
The monitoring and logging additions will help track performance effectively. Everything meets the acceptance criteria, and the latency reduction is impressive. LGTM, approved!

title: Implement AES-256 Encryption for Data Privacy
summary: This PR implements AES-256 encryption to ensure data privacy and security for all data processed within the application. The encryption is applied to both data at rest and data in transit.

review_states.comment: The AES-256 encryption for data at rest looks solid. Nice work on that! However, we need more documentation on how this complies with data privacy regulations. Please add that.

The implementation for data at rest is well done. However, the encryption for data in transit isn't fully integrated with our existing network protocols. Please ensure compatibility with our current TLS setup.

title: Implement Feedback Data Integration with Salesforce
summary: Develop the integration layer that allows feedback collected by the bot to be seamlessly transferred and stored in Salesforce. This ensures that user feedback is accessible for analysis and reporting.

review_states.comment: Just finished reviewing the data transfer part. Everything looks solid, and the logging is a nice touch! No data loss detected in my tests. LGTM, approved! ðŸš€

title: Optimize Network Communication for Edge and Central Servers
summary: This PR aims to optimize the network communication between edge nodes and central servers to ensure efficient data transfer and synchronization. It involves implementing protocols and strategies to minimize bandwidth usage and improve data throughput.

review_states.comment: The network protocols are optimized, achieving a bandwidth reduction of around 16%. Performance benchmarks are solid with improved data throughput and reduced network latency. Everything checks out from my side. LGTM, approved!

The documentation is clear and accurately reflects the changes in communication strategies. Data synchronization tests show reliable performance. All acceptance criteria are met, and the improvements are evident. LGTM, approved!

title: Set Up Parallel GraphQL System for Downtime Mitigation
summary: This PR establishes a parallel GraphQL system to ensure continuous availability during the transition from REST to GraphQL. This setup includes load balancing and failover mechanisms.

review_states.comment: The parallel GraphQL system setup looks solid and operational alongside the REST API. Great job on that! Please ensure to add some monitoring alerts to catch any potential downtime during the transition.
The setup is impressive, but the load balancing and failover mechanisms haven't been fully tested. Please address the edge cases that might cause issues during peak loads.
